document_data.mainbody:
'''Iggwilv''', also known as '''Tasha''' or '''Natasha''',Iggwilv and Tasha were originally separate characters until they were retconned to be the same person in [[Wikipedia:Expedition to the Ruins of Greyhawk|''Expedition to the Ruins of Greyhawk'']] in 2007. and the alias '''Zybilna''', was an [[Oerth]]ian [[archmage]] and demonologist. She famously wrote the ''[[Demonomicon of Iggwilv]]'', a tome on demonic lore. 

Later in life she created her own [[Domain of Delight]] in the [[Feywild]],
document_data.Description:
[[File:Tasha2-5e.jpg|thumb|''Tasha in her study.'']]
The exact appearance of Iggwilv was unknown to many. Some described her as a ravishing beauty, while others claimed she was a bald and hideous crone.{{Cite book| author = [[Roger E. Moore]]| title = Return of the Eight| short_story = | date = May 1998| editor = [[Kij Johnson]]| publisher = [[TSR]]| ISBN = 0-7869-1247-2 | pages = {{{1|55}}}}} In fact Iggwilv was quite beautiful in her youth with raven hair that eventually went stark white. Even after becoming an archfey, she still retained a human-like appearance.
document_data.Abilities:
During her stay in the [[Abyss]], Iggwilv became extremely knowledgeable about the political hierarchy and goings on between the various powers within. She was considered a master at [[summoning]] [[fiend]]s, planar exploration, [[necromancy|necromantic magic]], and later in life, gained command over [[fey]] beings.

As an archfey, Iggwilv was immortal and could not die from aging.
document_data.Possessions:
[[File:Iggwilv_and_demonomicon-3e.jpg|thumb|left|200px|''Iggwilv and the ''Demonomicon''.'']]
Iggwilv had a vast collection of magic items, oddities and personal mementos that she kept within the [[Palace of Heart's Desire]] in her home plane of [[Prismeer]]. Notable among these were a [[Mirror of Heart's Desire|magical mirror]] that showed the individual gazing into it what they desired most in the reflection within; three [[jar of time|jars of time]], that displayed the visage of a being at three different points in their life, a magical [[Chess (game)|chessboard]] gifted to her by the [[archmage]] [[Mordenkainen]], and the [[vorpal]] [[greatsword]] ''[[Snicker-Snack]]''.

One of Iggwilv's most wondrous and powerful items was her ''[[Iggwilv's Cauldron|personal cauldron]]'', an [[artifact]] that she crafted with the assistance of her adoptive mother. It held two different forms and many magical properties, including the power to permanently 'freeze time' for everyone within a {{SIAdj|1000|ft}} radius. 

Her personal library held [[tome]]s that originated from across the planes. Notable titles included ''[[The City That Waits]]'', ''[[I, Lyzandred]]'', ''[[Kingdom of the Ghouls]]'', ''[[The Many Masques of Mith]]'', ''[[Nadir of Nessus]]'', ''[[Prophecies of Explictica Defilus]]'', and ''[[Thingizzard's Night Balloon]]''.

On her person Iggwilv wore a ''[[robe of the archmagi]]'' and an ''[[amulet of the planes]]''. During her time in the Abyss, she wielded a ''[[staff of power]]''.

Activities.Spells:
Iggwilv was credited with a number of [[spell]]s, most of which were described in the ''Demonomicon''.{{Cite dragon/336/Spellcraft: The Demonomicon of Iggwilv|76-84}} Her spells included: ''[[dolor (spell)|Dolor]]''; ''[[ensnarement]]''; ''[[exaction]]''; ''[[imbrue]]''; ''[[implore]]''; ''[[Tasha's hideous laughter]],'' ''[[Tasha's mind whip]]''; and ''[[torment]]''

Apart from spells developed by her, Iggwilv was credited the creation of ''[[Tasha's Atrocious Robe]]'' that was brought to [[Toril]] by planeswalker [[Mintassan]] the Magnificent. The [[enchanted]] [[robe]] was among the wizard's extensive collection of curios from across the multiverse, displayed in [[Mintassan's Mysteries]] in [[Westgate]] as of the {{YearlinkName|1374}}.

document_data.History:
[[File:Iggwilv WBW.png|thumb|right|250px|''Iggwilv the Witch Queen, as an [[archfey]].'']]
{{Quote|I can't tell you how many times I've burned everything to the ground and started over.|Iggwilv, under her pen name ''Tasha''.}}
Iggwilv was born in the world of Oerth and was adopted by the witch Baba Yaga, at which time she was known as Natasha "the Dark". She became known later as Tasha, before adopting her alias of Iggwilv, although it was not clear whether any of those was her original name. It was at that early point that she was credited with inventing the ''Tasha's hideous laughter'' spell. 

At one point she moved to [[Niflheim]], the second layer of [[Hades]].

Some time later Iggwilv settled in the [[Abyss]] and immersed herself in the study of [[demon]]-summoning and lore regarding demonic spirits. She sought to garner more power for herself, but made many enemies among the chaotic fiends and fled to worlds beyond for her safety. Eventually, Iggwilv moved to her own [[Domain of Delight]], known as [[Prismeer]], in the [[Feywild]], where she ruled from the [[Palace of Heart's Desire]] in the guise of Zybilna. Over time she transformed into a fey being and refocused her studies on that newfound state of existence rather than demonology.

She was eventually betrayed by the three daughters of Baba Yaga, the hags of the Hourglass Coven, and their cronies in the [[League of Malevolence]]. who used the magic of her ''[[Iggwilv's Cauldron|personal cauldron]]'' to freeze in time the Witch Queen and many of her palace's other inhabitants.
